website_summaries.verdict: Featuring 60 delicious treat-like chicken liver chews per bottle, K-BroVet delivers a potent anti-seizure medication that your dog will be thrilled to wolf down, making “medicine time” as engaging as “treat time.”
pros: Available in 2 dosage sizes, 250 mg and 500 mg. Tasty liver flavored chewable tablet
Can be used alongside other anti-seizure medications
cons: Side effects may include increased hunger, increased thirst, and nausea

customer_reviews.title: I really like all the ingredients that is listed on the bag
customer_reviews.text: I really like all the ingredients that is listed on the bag. Four stars for that!!! However, this is like kid's lucky charms cereal. My cat loves to pick out the raw pieces and eat that first and leave out the rest..... he'll eat the rest of it when he has no choice, but he will remind me that he hasn't been fed, when there's still the rest of the food left in the bowl!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Cat paws

customer_reviews.title: I had bad experience with Instinct Dog Food as well
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 cats. All of them walked away after sniffing the food. I had bad experience with Instinct Dog Food as well, it made my two dogs sick. Maybe cats are smarter since they don't even try.
customer_reviews.author: roor

customer_reviews.title: Vomiting
customer_reviews.text: My cat kept vomiting this food. This may have caused a inflamed gallbladder and pancreas in my cat. My cat is now on a vet prescribed blend. I thought I was doing the right thing but apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Southern Wife

customer_reviews.title: Eyewitness testimony
customer_reviews.text: It seems strange to write a review for a food product I never tasted, so (obviously) I can only base this review as a witness to a cat food dish. Nevertheless, I can only give this 3 stars because my cats didn't seem quite as excited about this food as I had hoped they would be. They ate it, but often left the meat bits behind. I bought both the chicken and the rabbit versions, and I noticed the chicken went over a bit more than the rabbit. Either way, only 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Tasty, but made my cat sick
customer_reviews.text: My cat loved the taste of this product and was always excited for dinner time BUT it made her throw up everywhere. After comparing the ingredients to other foods that I have given her (Fromm Family Gold, Taste of the Wild, Blue Buffalo, etc.) I thought that it may be the tapioca powder or the Menhaden fish meal. If you try it, start with a small bag to see if your cat is ok!
customer_reviews.author: John Q. Public

customer_reviews.title: Great for ferrets too
customer_reviews.text: Great for ferrets too. Mine loves this food, it was suggested by my vet. As everyone may know, ferrets tend to be a little smelly, this helps control the smell. I feed her once a day and she is getting bigger and putting on a little weight. Since she is strictly carnivore, its hard to find a good food but this has everything she needs.
customer_reviews.author: Max Kans

customer_reviews.title: Good food but a lot of crumbled kibble.
customer_reviews.text: I like the product, it is why I bought it. I was transferring it out of the bag & it is about 1/3-1/4th crumbs. I have purchased in the store and it is not like this. I am not sure if it is that this is a bigger bag and therefore easier to crush the “raw” kibble parts. Or just the shipping caused it to crumble so much. While the price was good, my cat doesn’t care for crumbs over kibble. Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Roberts

customer_reviews.title: A good kibble for ferrets, but you should mix it
customer_reviews.text: This has a decent nutrition content for ferrets as far as kibbles though. A lot of ferrets get sick on wysong bc it's so rich. Mixing this with 2 other kibbles so the ferrets don't get sick if the recipe suddenly changes is a good idea. I love that there are raw pieces in it. My ferrets really enjoy it and my dog steals it any chance he gets. You can buy the freeze dried raw bits separately in a little bag and my pets love it as a treat. Alfie hoardes the raw pieces if he can and I'll find him munching on them in his hiding places
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: Undoubtedly a good product, but my cat didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: Initially when I gave her this she seemed to really love it, but then it just sat in her dish while she plaintively meowed for her usual food. Of course I gave in. I will agree with other reviewers who stated that the size of the raw bits seems overly large. I know cats are predatory meat eaters, but still. I feel like this is a good product based on ingredients, so your mileage may vary. I just have to spoil my senior girl and give her what she wants.
customer_reviews.author: srichey216

customer_reviews.title: Cat Weight loss success
customer_reviews.text: First of all I am so happy that I found a cat food that doesn’t have corn ingredients in it. My cat has lost all her extra weight in the last two months thanks to this food. She was eager to eat this food at first but now she leaves the protein boost nuggets in her bowl. She doesn’t care for them. So we have switched to the original version without the added boost nuggets.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlan

customer_reviews.title: I don't like getting tricked
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat that has pancreatitis and diabetes. He isn't allowed to eat this food. My other 3 cats like this food, but I recently took an empty bag to my vet so he could check the ingredients (so we can see if the diabetic cat can have it or not) and he said when he first started reading the bag, he was excited...until he read the ingredients. His assessment is that it's just cheap kibble with a lot of fillers and a few pieces of freeze dried meat (also with fillers). Beware of cheap food with a high price to make you think it's quality.
customer_reviews.author: debbie

customer_reviews.title: GOSH, DARN! GREAT TO KITTY, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Colby, our rather large solid black cat, loves this. HOWEVER! Standing in front of the sink, two feet away from the bowl of this, it stinks! The smell is so "fishy" smelling and it permeates the room. Sorry, although top quality and value, I am changing foods as I cannot relocate the bowl out of his/my habits just to get rid of the smell! The other three kitties will eat this food only in an "emergency" hunger when their wet food plate(s) are empty! So I am not sure if YOUR cat will really like this food. Seventy-five percent of my cats say, "No!"
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: MY CAT LOVES THE CRUNCHIES BUT HATES THE RAW BOOST
customer_reviews.text: My cat is overweight and I purchased this food to help him lose weight and gain energy. He loves the crunchy portion but hates the raw food boost. He picks around it. Going forward I will buy the bag without the raw food boost...if they have one.
customer_reviews.author: Jodie Peters

customer_reviews.title: My cat didn't eat it
customer_reviews.text: I went from Hills Science Diet to this. I tried to transition him to the new food but he just didn't like it. I have outdoor rescues that eat anything and even they didn't like it. I have to mix the Instinct Raw Boost with the Purina so they eat it. I bought this food because its supposed to make the poop less stinky with raw good foods for the cat. Unfortunately, I couldn't get him to eat it to see if his poop would be less stink. Now, my cat has a urinary problem so he's back on Hills but the prescription diet c/d.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't touch it; Dog won't eat hers either
customer_reviews.text: The cat won't eat it, even when only a little is mixed with her normal food. Upon closer examination, the food looks moldy. The same with the dog, who usually loves to get a bite of the cat's food. I also ordered a bag of the Instinct dog food, but the dog doesn't want to eat that either. For a cost of more than $5.00 per pound, I am afraid to try it again. I am sad that such high hopes were dashed. The company did refund my money with no questions asked. I hope I just got a bad bag.
customer_reviews.author: Book MavenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Trial and error for picky cats.
customer_reviews.text: COVID has caused access to my cats regular foods to become intermittent, and delivery unreliable. I’ve been looking for replacements and she’s being very picky. In the comparison for what’s she’s willing to eat, this is second best out of 5 attempted dry food replacements, behind Crave, ahead of Hills. She tricked me though into initially thinking she liked the freeze dried “raw” bits. So I bought a whole bag as toppers... turns out she hates them and will gum them up and take them out of her dish.
customer_reviews.author: Rubblemuss

customer_reviews.title: Sick cats
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for months with no problem. New bag is making my cats vomit and they won't eat it. Switched food and they stopped. Hopefully this is an isolated issue.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: No Freeze-Dried Bits!
customer_reviews.text: Despite the picture and label on the bag, this cat food did NOT contain the freeze-dried bits as advertised— just kibble. Plus my cat, who has been eating Instinct Raw Boost his entire life, refuses to eat this at all. I suspect it’s a bad/stale batch. For a nearly $30 bag of cat food, you’d expect to get what you pay for. Very disappointed and strongly considering a new kibble for my cat.
customer_reviews.author: LilMissTNT

customer_reviews.title: It was great until it got bad.
customer_reviews.text: At first my roommate tried the same brand I had and their cat started vomiting and we blamed it on too rich food. Then I got another bag for my cat and she threw up the entire meal and got ill the rest of the night. I returned it that night, I have never seen that type of reaction in her for food.
customer_reviews.author: A. M Robertson

customer_reviews.title: My cat's enamored
customer_reviews.text: I rescued a cat who was caught and thought to be feral, so I don't think he's a picky eater. But I did a lot of research into the nutritional content of the dry and wet foods out there before purchasing anything (his foster had him on Purina One). I did mix this in with his previous food to transition him into it, but even now that it's his only dry food, this cat still absolutely loves it. I can even use the kibbles as training treats between meals.
customer_reviews.author: Sully

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and happy fur babies!
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 cats: 1 that thinks he is a dog (will eat anything and everything), 1 that is very picky (only eats dry food, and only specific brands at that) and 1 that has Kitty Crohn's so his tummy is very sensitive. This food makes all 3 of them very happy; it is GREAT for their fur (their coats are smoother and they shed less); and it doesn't make any of them sick. The only downfall? Our cat-dog hybrid LOVES the raw pieces so he makes a mess scooping around the kibbles to get to his favorite pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Good cat food
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food. I like the convenience of having it come to my front door. Great ingredients!
customer_reviews.author: Daisy V

customer_reviews.title: High quality food at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I have picky eaters, it has been a chore to find a food that meets my standards and that they will eat. Nature’s Instinct does the trick. By ordering through Amazon with the subscribe and save, I am able to give my animals a top quality food for a reasonable price. The savings is unmatched even when the pet food stores have a sale. The added bonus is that it is shipping directly to my house.
customer_reviews.author: ZingerGGG

customer_reviews.title: Instinct Raw Boost Grain for cats
customer_reviews.text: My cat LOVES it; & she loves the raw boost chicken bits & I like that it is healthier then most brands...
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Sick Animals
customer_reviews.text: All 3 cats are vomiting. Cancelling our sub and switching. This has been going on for three bags. One animal went to the vet. Do not feed this to your cats.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kay

customer_reviews.title: My Kitty Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I recently switched my cat off of Natures Recipe Cat Food because that specific brand of cat food has become so hard to find so tried out Instinct. He is picky by nature so took a few days to take to it but now that he's tried it he goubles it up! One thing I've noticed in switching him to this brand is he is not as gassy and his breath smells a ton better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cat adores it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat adores this stuff! It’s the only food that she RUNS to eat when I put it out. Correction: it’s the only food that she RUNS to eat that also doesn’t give her the runs, if you know what I mean... So many “quality” foods are tough on my cat’s tummy, so this is perfect. My dog also loves the little raw liver bits as a snack so it’s a two in one!
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Iosso

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. My 3 cats love it. Healthier coat and more energy.
customer_reviews.text: The product is good quality and smells healthy. My cats nibble on it often. Their breath smells better and their coats are shinier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats didn't like it
customer_reviews.text: I have 11 cats - none liked it. Some picked out the freeze dried pieces, but ultimately did not touch the food. I put it outside for the feral cats. They barely picked at it. So between my cats and the feral cats, definitely not an appealing food for cats on the market from our experience. Won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: A. Drewes ❤ Product Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: they don't enjoy the freeze-dried part of the food
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few top quality brands and haven't had much luck, until this one (duck). Unfortunately, they don't enjoy the freeze-dried part of the food, so I've switched to the one without the kibble. Still, would recommend, if your cat is into it!
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: No Go.
customer_reviews.text: Cat's did not like it & would not eat it. Not many "raw" ingredient in the bag, for sure, but they would not even touch those,
customer_reviews.author: susan

customer_reviews.title: Like puzzles?
customer_reviews.text: Seriously great pet food. But, the bag. Are you kidding me? I'd have more luck solving the world's mysteries than I have using the ziploc closing that they put ON THE SIDE of the bag! I'm pretty sure that I can solve a Rubik's cube faster and with more pleasure than I would have trying to close this stupid thing. Whoever designed this thing obviously has a cruel sense of humor. He probably would find joy in giving Jerry's kids Chinese finger cuffs. He can kiss my cat's derrie aire.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C. Schlieper

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredients, but Pricey
customer_reviews.text: My cats seemed to like this food but I was a little shocked in the bag size. I guess I didn't pay attention to how little food you get for the money so I won't buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie House

customer_reviews.title: Might be good for cats, but that doesn't mean they will eat it.
customer_reviews.text: My cats would not eat it. They are not picky eaters. One of my cats eats steamed broccoli. The other one eats anything you give him, but both sniffed at this food and walked away. Gave it to a neighbor who has cats.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food as cat has bowel syndrome and vet said Royal Canin not good for the cat. She is a picky eater, but loves this food. Seems to have healthy ingredients. I mix in some Nutra Thrive and no longer throwing up at least once per day, etc from the Irritable Bowel Syndrome.
customer_reviews.author: Lilly

customer_reviews.title: MY FINICKY KITTY LOVES THIS FOOD!!
customer_reviews.text: Not only do I appreciate that this food is healthy and nutritional...my kitty absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: TLRCLR

customer_reviews.title: That it’s grain free
customer_reviews.text: Love that this food is grain free, but they need to add more freeze dried chicken chunks because there’s not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Morris

customer_reviews.title: Cat enjoys!
customer_reviews.text: We switched to this after cat started vomiting blue buffalo chicken variety. Since then, no more vomiting! He does tend to pick out the raw bits first and then go back for the rest, but he eats it all.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: My cats did not like it
customer_reviews.text: I thought that my cats may like this product over Hill Science Diet, when I was switching them from Kitten to Adult, but I was wrong.
customer_reviews.author: TAK

customer_reviews.title: Good ingredient
customer_reviews.text: Our 15 year old cat loves it! She spends some time nibbling the dark kibbles until she can get to those yummy looking chicken pieces. She's a fussy eater but she really likes this one.
customer_reviews.author: Jefferson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: My cats a butthead and only eats the duck parts first but she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Keri

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love this cat food and so do my kitties! My recent feral turned house cat went from a brittle rough coat to a shiny soft one. Do be aware, if you feed your cats with an auto/gravity feeder, there is the potential of them trying to dig out more freeze dried pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Beans

customer_reviews.title: Good food
customer_reviews.text: Cats like it decided to do small bags to maintain freshness
customer_reviews.author: Girl and a dog

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: My kitten absolutely loves him some instinct cat food. I go a mixture of the kitten and the raw blend since hes still young. He loves it so much he wakes me every morning meowing to feed him. Looked up the ingredients online and compared to other brands and Instinct is in the top 5
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Clark

customer_reviews.title: Made My MauMau Sick!
customer_reviews.text: The ingredient quality is great, however, my MauMau eventually tried it and after a couple of days she started throwing up. Then she wouldn't eat anymore of it. (I wouldn't either!)
customer_reviews.author: KAT

customer_reviews.title: My cat hated it
customer_reviews.text: Did not want it dry or moist, did not matter, she hated it
customer_reviews.author: Samikyswifey

customer_reviews.title: My kitty loves this.....I use it as treats in stead of they daily food.....
customer_reviews.text: I use this food as treats for my kitty in stead of the store bought kind..this is more healthy..it’s expensive but I only give a few pieces each time so it last...he loves it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: ShoeCrazy8

customer_reviews.title: We purchased this for our ferret. He loves the ...
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our ferret. He loves the stuff. We pulled out the freeze-dried chicken pieces and use those as ferret treats. Ferrets are strict carnivores, so various fillers and plant-based ingredients are harmful to their digestive systems. It's pretty hard to find good kibble that doesn't have a lot of plant matter. Even among ferret foods, this one is really good and is quite reasonably priced. He's a healthy, happy 3-year old ferret that has been eating this kibble his entire life.
customer_reviews.author: psigran

customer_reviews.title: Kitty Approved
customer_reviews.text: My kitty ate her whole serving and wanted more! Usually she is not a fan of hard food but this she seemed to really enjoy. I’m happy because the ingredients are all natural compared to most other cat foods.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Eno

customer_reviews.title: My cats love Instinct cat food
customer_reviews.text: My cats love Instinct cat food. This type seems like the same as the cheaper plain kibble just with little bits in it that I guess are "raw food". I didn't order it again. Just doesn't seem like it's worth the extra money for the little bits. But, I do give the plain kibble Instinct Cat Food 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: took a long time to be deliverd
customer_reviews.text: my cat doesn't seem to like it any better than her old food and this was quite expensive, I wont buy again,
customer_reviews.author: James Allman

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful healthy cats deserve this!
customer_reviews.text: My cats won’t eat anything else. The vet has asked me what I feed them because their coats are so silky and beautiful! They are 6 years old and have eaten this since they were 8 week rescues. They love the little raw boosts and grab those first!
customer_reviews.author: NordicLady

customer_reviews.title: Instinct Raw Boost Grain Free Recipe Natural Dry Cat Food by Nature's Variety - old?
customer_reviews.text: My cat would not touch this. I smelled old and fishy, and this was chicken.!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Cat won't eat
customer_reviews.text: My cat took one smell and walked away. I have tried letting her go hungry she still walks away from it. So no matter how did your ingredients are if my cat won't eat it it's worthless. Plus it was quite expensive for very small bag.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Britt

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it...and they lose weight.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a healthy kibble that the cats enjoy and it doesn't make them fat. Each cat lost 1lb this year by switching .
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Olivieri

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It.
customer_reviews.text: I love not having to remember to buy it, just have it shipped every couple of months and it comes to the house.
customer_reviews.author: MiMi

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat has no problem eating this food. He usually eats the freeze dried first and then works on the rest.
customer_reviews.author: tina

customer_reviews.title: For my very picky feline,
customer_reviews.text: She is a Norwegian Forest cat and she is the pickiest animal I have ever met. She loves this food though. I wish companies like this ran sales, had coupons, ect to help offset the cost though. If they did I would not just mix this in her reg friskies but buy it exclusively.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Not pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: So I opened this bag and there’s no raw bits! None. I’m assuming that’s a mistake? Check your food I think this is counterfeit
customer_reviews.author: Ray Ruballos

customer_reviews.title: Great food for our senior cat.
customer_reviews.text: My senior cat is doing great on this product. Since he's been on this diet, weve seen a better more energetic cat. Unfortunately he doesn't feel a need to hunt for fresh food these days. Happy cat though.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy La Praim

customer_reviews.title: Healthy cat food
customer_reviews.text: Love this stuff and my cats do too! It’s the only thing I’ll feed them. My older cat, Oliver had been on it since he was born and I swear he’s smart and healthy and the diet he’s on contributes to that. Just because they’re animals doesn’t mean they don’t deserve/need healthy food.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Stahl

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about this
customer_reviews.text: None of my cats would eat it, but they are very picky eaters. Every cat is different.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne L. Siler

customer_reviews.title: Kitties just live it!
customer_reviews.text: My cats love it! It is a new introduction and a wise one. My cats pick out the freeze dried nuggets and think they are treats.
customer_reviews.author: graciemae

customer_reviews.title: good for your average cat
customer_reviews.text: Good quality but my cats don't care much for it. I bought it in the search for a cat food that would help my cat's IBS. It was a step up from the stuff before but not as good as Castor and pollux
customer_reviews.author: Jaelyntrobaugh

customer_reviews.title: Cat liked it for a while
customer_reviews.text: Cat liked it till we got near the bottom of the bag. Then she just picked at it. When it got older yet, she just walked away. Maybe it got old. You might want to buy the smallest size.
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: It's a great idea, but unfortunately- my cats did not like ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a great idea, but unfortunately- my cats did not like it. I think the kibble size is a little larger than they are accustomed to and the flavor did not compensate.
customer_reviews.author: Sondra Deenst

customer_reviews.title: Yum
customer_reviews.text: My bengal cat loves this brand of food. I buy both the canned wet food as well as this dry food and mix them up for my cat. The protein freeze-dry chunks are a nice addition to my cat's diet and she cannot get enough! She looks forward to meal time.
customer_reviews.author: Brendon Han

customer_reviews.title: Happy full ferrets
customer_reviews.text: My ferrets love this food! We mix it with two other brand, and I was a bit nervous they would not want it because this is the first cat food we try and they stuffed their whittle faces=)
customer_reviews.author: Dia vu

customer_reviews.title: Cat absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I've not actually tasted it my self but my kitty loves it and picks them out of the kibble before any of my other kitties get to it.
customer_reviews.author: Steno Mom

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: Super high quality food! My cats like it and it is keeping them healthy! They hardly vomit any more and their coats are great!
customer_reviews.author: Jade Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good food
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food! And it’s grain free for my over weight cat
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Not for my cats
customer_reviews.text: My picky cats hate this. They pick out the chicken pieces and leave the kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Julia Morris

customer_reviews.title: My cat wouldn’t eat the chicken.
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality food. My cat wouldn’t eat the chicken,, so back to our old brand.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Cats didn't like this product. Prefer Purina. Wish they had eaten it as the ingredients are healthier.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this stuff. Not that they're picky, but they gobble up the freeze dried bits. I was going to try and switch to something cheaper, but don't see anything comparable for less $.
customer_reviews.author: Auntie J

customer_reviews.title: My savannah loves this food. She eats all the ...
customer_reviews.text: My savannah loves this food. She eats all the chicken bits out before the kibble but loves it none the less!
customer_reviews.author: Kesley

customer_reviews.title: They liked it
customer_reviews.text: My 3 cats liked it, especially the white chunks. They would always eat that first.
customer_reviews.author: Ida Grant

customer_reviews.title: Making our cats sick
customer_reviews.text: We transitioned to this food but both of our cats have violently been throwing up undigested food. We won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: FerrisFire

customer_reviews.title: My cat will not eat it.
customer_reviews.text: She pushes most of it out of her bowl, not fun to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Lint

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for pet
customer_reviews.text: Cat likes it, and hasn’t had any digestive issues while on it
customer_reviews.author: Crimson_Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I get instinct raw boost for all my pets and they love it. Healthy meal for a solid price
customer_reviews.author: Joey O

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this stuff. I like the ingredients...healthy and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Genoa

customer_reviews.title: Cats liked it.
customer_reviews.text: Wanted something better for outdoor cats and they seemed to like it.
customer_reviews.author: aed

customer_reviews.title: Love it for ferrets
customer_reviews.text: Petco recommended this for our ferrets and they live it and look healthy
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Webb

customer_reviews.title: Food is not okay with my cats
customer_reviews.text: I have an inside cat who is picky and an outside cat who came to me as a kitten that will not come inside and both do not like this food so I need to look for something that they will enjoy. I did not like the smell of the food, that turned me off but I still wanted to see if my cats like it and they gave it a big paw down.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne MacLachlan

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Cats love it. We also add raw instinct bites to it for extra raw food.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal L.

customer_reviews.title: food doesn't look the same as other retailers
customer_reviews.text: My cats have had this before and the look of the food and the cats excitement for the food are not the same as the bag I got from chewy. At least there are more raw bits. Heavily considering never ordering food from Amazon again.
customer_reviews.author: Portia e.

customer_reviews.title: Bigger Bag!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I wish is that this came with the option for a larger bag size.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Suchnicki

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality food.
customer_reviews.text: It is kind of expensive but my cata and my hedgehog adore this food. It is all tbey want to eat. My cats won't touch anything else now. They love the real pieces of dried chicken.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bynum

customer_reviews.title: Cat enjoys it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it and switched over fine from the previous kind that didn’t have the big pieces of raw food in it.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Wegener

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Our picky boys love this recipe. And no more hair balls!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer M LeBlanc

customer_reviews.title: Good Ingredients
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this food! Feeding him this for years.
customer_reviews.author: Trish

customer_reviews.title: Really good as weight loss
customer_reviews.text: Our overweight cat loved this food and i helped him lose the 5 lbs that he need to lose safely and overtime. buying it through amazon as cost efficient and time saving
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cat likes the duck flavor better. That one has more meat chucks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Lois

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. Really good for cats with sensitives stomachs.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a Persian cat is (4) years old! He has very delicate tummy the change has been amazing!! He loves it! Not only that the smell of poop is much better!! LOVES IT! Gets exited when I come to feed him!!
customer_reviews.author: ROSALY FIGUEROA

customer_reviews.title: The freeze dried chicken bits
customer_reviews.text: My cats really like this especially the chicken bits. I think it's a good product for the money.
customer_reviews.author: siouxdogg

customer_reviews.title: The cats love it
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my cats who were having some health issues. No issues since we switched to this food and they love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Anges

customer_reviews.title: Will love this
customer_reviews.text: The healthy product was cat food. I normally mix2 brands and different flavors. At1st my cats want only the less healthier of the 2 brands, but now they love this too.
customer_reviews.author: Anna Ahonen

customer_reviews.title: Cats don’t like it.
customer_reviews.text: checked the review was good so I purchased 2 bags for my cats. None of them likes it at all. Wasted my money
customer_reviews.author: Jessie

product_meta.title: Instinct Raw Boost Grain Free Recipe Natural Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Flavor Name:Salmon| Size:4.5 lb. BagInstinct Raw Boost is a better way to feed cat food – high protein, grain free dry cat food mixed with all natural bites of freeze dried raw meat, all in one bag. With real meat as the 1st ingredient, this high protein cat food is healthy nutrition boosted with probiotics to support healthy digestion and omegas for skin and coat. This best selling cat food is made without grain, potato, corn, wheat, soy, by product meal, artificial colors or preservatives - ingredients known to trigger food sensitivity. Raw Boost grain free cat food is complete and balanced nutrition for all cats and is available in a variety of natural dry cat food recipes: Wild Caught Salmon, Cage Free Chicken, Cage Free Duck, Farm Raised Rabbit, Indoor Health, Healthy Weight. Made in the USA with the finest ingredients from around the world. Satisfaction guaranteed. Questions? Call Instinct at 888-519-7387.
feature_bullets: GRAIN FREE CAT FOOD WITH FREEZE DRIED RAW: Instinct Raw Boost dry cat food combines high protein, grain free kibble with natural bites of freeze dried raw. Wild caught salmon is the #1 ingredient plus all natural, functional ingredients.

NATURAL CAT FOOD PLUS FREEZE DRIED RAW PIECES: Raw Boost is high protein cat food with probiotics to support healthy digestion and omegas for skin & coat. Made without grain, potato, corn, wheat, soy, by product meal, artificial colors or preservatives.

THE FIRST RAW BOOSTED KIBBLE: Raw Boost mixes high protein, grain free cat food with our freeze dried raw cat food toppers in one bag. Balanced nutrition for all cats & solutions for indoor & healthy weight. Delicious flavor that picky cats & kittens love

POWER OF RAW INGREDIENTS: Our cat food is made with the pure, real nutrition of raw. Raw is natural, made from real meat & whole food ingredients, protein packed & minimally processed. Made in the USA with the finest ingredients from around the world.

OUR BEST CAT FOOD BOOSTED WITH RAW: We craft dry & wet cat food from real ingredients. Compare Instinct to Blue Buffalo, Fancy Feast, Hills Science Diet, Royal Canin, Rachel Ray, Natural Balance, Merrick, Purina One, Friskies, Wellness, Iams & Weruva.
